content.description: <math alttext="Z n solid plus C u S O 4 aqueous, reacts to produce, C u solid plus Z n S O 4 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CuSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>ZnSO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: When a zinc plate is placed in an aqueous solution of copper sulfate, elemental copper forms, as represented by the equation above. Which of the following represents the reduction half-reaction of the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons, reacts to produce C u solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="C u solid reacts to produce C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Z n solid, plus 2 electrons, reacts to produce, Z n with a negative 2 charge aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="Z n solid reacts to produce Z n with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="C u with a positive 2 charge aqueous, plus 2 electrons, reacts to produce C u solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
